Package com.quantum.utils

Class DeviceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.quantum.utils.DeviceUtils
  • public class DeviceUtils
extends Object
    DeviceUtils class contains set of utility methods, which help in interacting with the test device on Perfecto Continues testing platform.

      • installApp

        public static void installApp​(String filePath,
                              boolean shouldInstrument)
        Install app in the device using Perfecto command
        Parameters:
        filePath - - The full repository path, including directory and file name, where to locate the application.
        shouldInstrument - - Boolean value representing whether to instrument or not.

      • installApp

        public static void installApp​(String repoKey,
                              String instrument)
        Install app in the device using Perfecto command
        Parameters:
        repoKey - - Key used in Configuration manager getbundle to retrieve App Perfecto repo path.
        instrument - - String value representing whether to instrument or not.

      • installApp

        public static void installApp​(String repoKey,
                              String instrument,
                              String sensorInstrument,
                              String resignEnable)
        Parameters:
        repoKey - - The full repository path, including directory and file name, where to locate the application.
        instrument - - Perform instrumentation.. Possible values :noinstrument (default) | instrument.
        sensorInstrument - - Enable device sensor. Possible values: nosensor (default)| sensor.
        resignEnable - - Re-sign the app with a Perfecto code-signing certificate that has the cloud device provisioned. Possible values false (default) | true.

      • installInstrumantedAppOnAndroid

        public static void installInstrumantedAppOnAndroid​(String repoKey,
                                                   String instrument,
                                                   String sensorInstrument,
                                                   String certificateFile,
                                                   String certificateUser,
                                                   String certificatePassword,
                                                   String certificateParams)
        For Android devices: - The appplication manifest.xml file must include internet access permission: <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET"/> - The application will automatically be signed with an Android debug key to enable native object automation.
        Parameters:
        repoKey - - The full repository path, including directory and file name, where to locate the application.
        instrument - - Perform instrumentation.. Possible values :noinstrument (default) | instrument.
        sensorInstrument - - Enable device sensor. Possible values: nosensor (default)| sensor.
        certificateFile - - The repository path, including directory and file name, of the certificate for certifying the application after instrumentation. This is the Keystore file in Android devices.
        certificateUser - - The user for certifying the application after instrumentation.This is the Key Alias in Android devices.
        certificatePassword - - The password for certifying the application after instrumentation. This is the Keystore Password in Android devices.
        certificateParams - - The key password parameter for certifying the application after instrumentation. This is the Key Password in Android devices. The value must be preceded with "keypass".

      • pressKey

        public static void pressKey​(String keySequence)
        Clicks on a single or sequence of physical device keys. Mouse-over the device keys to identify them, then input into the Keys parameter according to the required syntax.

        Common keys include: LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN, OK, BACK, MENU, VOL_UP, VOL_DOWN, CAMERA, CLEAR.

        The listed keys are not necessarily supported by all devices. The available keys depend on the device.

        Parameters:
        keySequence - the single or sequence of keys to click

      • swipe

        public static void swipe​(String start,
                         String end)
        Performs the swipe gesture according to the start and end coordinates.

        Example swipe left:
        start: 60%,50% end: 10%,50%

        Parameters:
        start - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended).
        end - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended).

      • longTouch

        public static void longTouch​(String point,
                             int seconds)
        Performs the tap gesture according to location coordinates with durations in seconds.

        Parameters:
        point - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended).
        seconds - The duration, in seconds, for performing the touch operation.

      • touchObject

        public static void touchObject​(String loc,
                               String addressBar)
        This function will calculate the location of the element on the device and manually tap the point location of the middle of the element. This function accounts that there may be a header to offset from.
        Parameters:
        loc - - locator to find the element to be clicked
        addressBar - - navigation bar that takes up the top half of the device outside of the webview

      • slideObjectLeft

        public static void slideObjectLeft​(String loc)
        Slides the provided object to the left
        Parameters:
        loc - object to slide

      • slideObject

        public static void slideObject​(String loc,
                               float xStartMult,
                               float xEndMult,
                               float yMult)
        Slides the provided object
        Parameters:
        loc - object to slide
        xStartMult - - x point to start on
        xEndMult - - y point to end on
        yMult - - y point for both the start and stop

      • slideObject

        public static void slideObject​(String loc,
                               float xStartMult,
                               float xEndMult,
                               float yStartMult,
                               float yEndMult)
        Slides the provided object
        Parameters:
        loc - object to slide
        xStartMult - - x point to start on
        xEndMult - - y point to end on
        yStartMult - - y point to start on
        yEndMult - - y point to end on

      • getScale

        public static int getScale()
        Gets the current application sacale for the device
        Returns:
        integer value of scale

      • getOffset

        public static int getOffset​(String addressBar)
        Gets the offset of the header values to offset y value of the header element
        Parameters:
        addressBar - - header element to measure
        Returns:
        the y offset of the element

                            String context)

        Parameters:
        addressBar - - header element to measure
        context - - context of the element to use
        Returns:
        the y offset of the element

      • checkAccessibility

        public static void checkAccessibility​(String tagName)
        Performs an audit of the accessibility features in the application. To check the entire application, this command needs to be repeated for each application screen.
        Parameters:
        tagName - - The tag that is appended to the name of the audit report to help match it to the application screen.

      • cloudCall

        public static void cloudCall​(String toHandset,
                             String toUser,
                             String toLogical,
                             String toNumber)
                      throws Exception
        Generates an external voice call recording to the selected destination It is possible to select multiple destinations that may include devices, users, and phone numbers. There is no default. To use, at least one destination must be selected.
        Parameters:
        toHandset - - The destination device. It is possible to select multiple devices.
        toUser - - The user for this command. It is possible to select multiple users.
        toLogical - - user | none The user currently running the script.
        toNumber - - The destination phone number. It is possible to select multiple phone numbers. Format - +[country code][area code][phone number]
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception thrown by method if no Destination is selected.

      • cloudEmail

        public static void cloudEmail​(String subject,
                              String body,
                              String toHandset,
                              String toAddress,
                              String toUser,
                              String toLogical)
                       throws Exception
        Sends an email message to the selected destination It is possible to select multiple destinations that may include email addresses, devices, and users. There is no default. At least one destination must be selected. If not specified, the message subject and body are be defaulted to none and test email. Confirm that the destination device is configured to receive email messages.
        Parameters:
        subject - - The message subject for this command. <default is "none">.
        body - - The message text for this command. <default is "test email">.
        toHandset - - The destination device. It is possible to select multiple devices.
        toAddress - - The email address for this command.
        toUser - - The user for this command. It is possible to select multiple users.
        toLogical - - user | none The user currently running the script.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception thrown by method if no Destination is selected.

      • cloudSMS

        public static void cloudSMS​(String body,
                            String toHandset,
                            String toUser,
                            String toLogical,
                            String toNumber)
                     throws Exception
        Sends an SMS message to the selected destination. It is possible to select multiple destinations that may include devices, users, and phones. There is no default. To use, at least one destination must be selected.
        Parameters:
        body - - The message text for this command. <default is "test email">.
        toHandset - - The destination device. It is possible to select multiple devices.
        toUser - - The user for this command. It is possible to select multiple users.
        toLogical - - user | none The user currently running the script.
        toNumber - - The destination phone number. It is possible to select multiple phone numbers. Format - +[country code][area code][phone number]
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception thrown by method if no Destination is selected.
